item.category: Fly-tip Small - Less than one bag

item.title: Grays inn road 49 to 57, 25th August
item.description:
I am writing to urgently report a serious safety hazard on Grays inn road 57. As shown in the attached photo, the raised pavement edge that runs directly alongside the double yellow lines is causing cyclists to fall. The edge is misleading because it looks like part of the road surface, but in reality it is an elevated curb. Cyclists who move too close to the edge are catching their wheels and falling. We had to call an ambulance for a cyclist who suffered an accident here. The situation is extremely dangerous and requires immediate attention. I strongly urge you to: • Install warning signs immediately, and/or • Mark the edge clearly with high-visibility paint, and/or • Put temporary barriers until a permanent solution is implemented. Please treat this as an urgent matter to prevent further accidents.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 55, Gray's Inn Road, Holborn, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin left on pavement to reserve parking, 25th August
item.description:

item.title: A decaying dead Fox in my front garden, 25th August
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bromley Gardens, Shortlands, London
